intro: Gymnostillingia macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its sprawling growth habit and fleshy, succulent stems. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are typically small, opposite, and covered in fine hairs, adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. Gymnostillingia macrantha is often found in sandy soils and is well-suited to xerophytic conditions.
